subject: Ice & Fire Calendar
event: Just posted an announcement on the news page about the 2009 SONG OF ICE AND FIRE calendar that the Dabel Brothers will be publishing. No need to repeat all that here; for them what's interested, check out my website for all the details. The calendar art is by the amazing Michael Komarck, who should need no introduction to fans of ICE & FIRE or WILD CARDS. Here's one of the paintings. Additionally, Pat's Fantasy Hotlist is offering three signed copies of limited edition calendar in one of their famous contests. To enter, go and visit Pat at http://fantasyhotlist.blogspot.com/2008/08/win-limited-edition-2009-song-of-ice.html and follow the instructions.

comments.article:
Wooooooohoooooooo




now off to squander my meeger financial aid check......
Oh, God. That's so hot.
I will definitely be purchasing one of these!
oh my god, awesome!

Does anyone know what else needs to be in the email to Pat's Fantasy Hotlist to enter the contest for the calendar besides your MB Screen name (if applicable), snail mail address and presumably your name?
that's all I put in mine. I hope that's all that's required!
That is some seriously detailed, gorgeous art. Congratulations on finding such an accomplished artist to portray your work!

When I read the title of this post, my brain did this:

calanader = dates = publishing dates = book finished!!!

But the art looks so good, I'm hardly disappointed at all :-)
comments.subject: Slight misunderstanding

comments.article: I kinda had a little bit of the same thing going on. I guess I have to re read the series to quench my thirst.
comments.subject: Re: Slight misunderstanding

comments.article:
I had to repeatedly email this company to get The Hedge Knight comics that I had pre-ordered. I eventually received the comics, but not the limited edition I had paid for.

I have no use for a 2009 calendar that I will receive in 2010!

Please be careful folks.
Wowie, George!
Wow, beautiful!  I'm praying that I win the contest, because otherwise I don't have enough spare shiny gold rocks to afford it.  :(

comments.upictitle: The Girl Who Waited: Solitary Witch
comments.article: I spent money that I don't really think I have... my weakness for fantasy art BE DAMNED!!!!
Everything sounds wonderful except this different artist every year part. I absolutely love all the Ice and Fire art Komarck has done and I think you should just force him do it every year. =)

comments.upictitle: the artist formerly known as pojy: asoiaf: ned
comments.article: Komarck is, by far, my favorite ASoIaF artist. I can't wait to put my hands on all those pretty illustrations! *_*

We have that very poster! It's framed and hanging on the wall in our sitting room, and it looks wonderful. :D

The calendar looks great too.

Shipping in *November*?

My local bookstores *already* have 2009 calendars out. Why are they making us wait so long?
Oh wow, thank you for the heads up. Had no idea about this and it looks incredible even from these small image previews.
Thank you for the heads-up mr. Martin, another copy has found a home. :-)
If all the paintings look that amazing, I'm definitely buying one :)

Just bought my autographed copy!

I bought it for the friend who introduced me to your books so I had to tell him I had bought it for him so I wouldn't be tempted to keep it for myself. ;)

But hey- that's what the contest is for, so maybe I can win one to keep. ;)

nice stuff.

Does DB ship overseas to australia?

All I could do is stare at the screen for 5 minutes screaming "I WANT" before reading the instructions.

LOL

those pictures look great
Are the Calender only available to Americans or people who live in the States? I live all the way down in Australia and I'd love to order one, but don't know if I can.
comments.subject: US only?

comments.article:
Love the artwork, love what they mean... snagged two!

Thanks!

PAR
comments.subject: Thanks for the calendar heads up!

comments.article: The calendar looks quite spiffy! However,your news page neglects  to mention which states it will be available in. I need to know if I can pick it up a few blocks away, or if I need to order one. Thanks!
comments.subject: Neato!

comments.article: OMG I LOVE THE ARTWORK. I want one so bad!
